result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence Jean Broeren in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant CHAD D BEHM in court.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for CHAD D BEHM. 
Attorney waives reading of complaint. Defendant is informed of charges. Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Review hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial
monitoring conditions.
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Not to possess syringes unless medically required.
Not to possess or consume any prescription drugs not prescribed.
Not to associate with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs drug paraphernalia.
Prosecuting attorney Sheila Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant CHAD D BEHM appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless appeared by video for CHAD D BEHM.
